lexUnit.name: short.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: of a small length or duration.

sentence.text: My own plans are somewhat uncertain because of the move , but I do plan to get away for a short break some time towards the end of the month , and I will keep you informed .
In summer Venice is crammed with tourists and the heat is often stifling , but autumn is perfect for a short break .
This very short break will enable you to return to speechreading with renewed energy , impetus and enthusiasm .
He and his wife were returning from a short break in Venice ( " no problems with public transport or with the plane " ) and arrived at King 's Cross station .
Then we had very short notice of an impending visit .
In the case of urgent difficulty , meetings can be arranged at short notice .
` Sorry to drag you across to the Yard at such short notice , " murmured Spittals , advancing towards her with what was intended to be a hearty smile of welcome .
Perhaps you missed the short period in which the fish were feeding ?

Studies at King 's College School of Medicine show that even a short period of hard pedalling on an exercise bike diverts blood flow from the uterus to the legs , ` stealing " oxygen from the foetus .
Only for a short period in the mid-1980s , when commodity prices and demand for semi-conductors slumped , did Malaysia risk hitting its borrowing ceiling .
This remarkable insect manages to time its reproductive cycle to coincide with its short period of exposure .
Then , as we saw in the previous chapter , it was introduced in Scotland in 1989 and in England and Wales in 1990 , but it lasted for a very short period .
For dairy farmers shorter courses were run but travel could still be considerable and some found it very difficult to attend .
He considered this for a short time and concluded that he had to make a public stand for those things which he believed .
Although I was tempted to think that such a short time would make no difference , I knew that when I got near to Kano , if I got that far , every minute would count .
` You can find out interesting things in a very short space of time , sir .
In certain cases the law imposes very short time limits within which you must act .
If this went well , he could be allowed off the lead to play with his new friend for a short while .
After a short while I started to see an osteopath , which really helped to relieve the pain , but again only temporarily .
Just for a short while let this be the most perfect day of my life .
Just a short while ago she had thought that nothing could increase the feeling of dread that Andrew had left behind him in the drawing-room .

Holmes and Forster interpreted this pattern as indicating that a listener 's processing load is least at clause boundaries , since reaction time should be shortest when a subject has the smallest processing load .
Watersports : Water skiing , sailing and windsurfing are all available in the nearby resort of Zell am See , which is a short journey away on a regular bus service .
The short answer to this contention on behalf of the appellant is that the money in the wallet which he appropriated belonged to another , to Mr. Occhi .
Pauses should not be too short .
The songs are mostly short and flash .
